00004 
00005         Copyright (C) 2004-2005 Cory Nelson
00006         Copyright (C) 2006 stephan beal (stephan s11n net)
00007 
00008         This software is provided 'as-is', without any express or implied
00009         warranty.  In no event will the authors be held liable for any damages
00010         arising from the use of this software.
00011 
00012         Permission is granted to anyone to use this software for any purpose,
00013         including commercial applications, and to alter it and redistribute it
00014         freely, subject to the following restrictions:
00015 
00016         1. The origin of this software must not be misrepresented; you must not
00017                 claim that you wrote the original software. If you use this software
00018                 in a product, an acknowledgment in the product documentation would be
00019                 appreciated but is not required.
00020         2. Altered source versions must be plainly marked as such, and must not be
00021                 misrepresented as being the original software.
00022         3. This notice may not be removed or altered from any source distribution.
00023         
00024 
00025 This file has been modified from the original sources by <stephan at
00026 s11n net>, as described briefly below.
00027 
00028 The original code, by Cory Nelson, is available from:
00029 
00030 http://dev.int64.org/sqlite.html
00031 
00032 This hacked copy's home is:
00033 
00034 http://wanderinghorse.net/computing/sqlite/
00035 
00036 Contributors to the hacked version include:
00037 
00038 stephan beal <stephan at s11n net>
00039 - Maintainer, documentor.
00040 
00041 Thomas Sailer <t.sailer at alumni ethz ch>:
00042 - A fix for wide-char support on 64-bit Linux.
00043 
00044 Artem Gr <artem at bizlink ru>
00045 - Fixes to enable/disable wide-char support with a macro.
00046 
00047 - Xose Anton Otero Ferreira submitted patches to remove 'long long'
00048 decls and replace those with sqlite_int64. He also submitted
00049 the isnull() functions.
00050  
00051 Kevin Ross <r0ssar00@gmail.com>
00052 - Added errorcode() function
00053 
00054 Significant changes from the original sqlite3x distribution include:
00055 
00056 - Removed dependency on boost library, since it was only a dependency
00057 on boost::non_copyable (this same effect is easily achieved without
00058 the dependency on the huge Boost library).
00059 
00060 - Reordered some code to get it to compile under gcc.
00061 
00062 - Added some missing #includes.
00063 
00064 - database_error was reimplemented to allow use of a varargs ctor.
00065 
00066 - Added a few helpful functions, like sqlite3_cursor::colcount().
00067 
00068 - Removed various (char const * ...) overloads which were inherently
00069 already covered by implicit conversions via (std::string const &)
00070 overloads. Re-added them on 2006.09.25 after Artem Gr pointed out that
00071 those overloads avoid a potential extra copy of the strings, and that
00072 this could be a significant performance factor for some applications.
00073 
00074 - Added lots of API docs.
00075 
00076 - Improved some exception messages.
00077 
00078 - Added table_generator class.
00079 
00080 - Added sqlite3_connection::executecallback().
00081 
00082 - sqlite3_cursor renamed to sqlite3_cursor (2007.01.22).
00083 
00084 - Added sqlite3_cursor::close()
00085 
00086 - sqlite3_cursor::read() renamed to step() (2007.01.22).
00087 
00088 */
00089 
00090 #include <string>

00094 // Enable WCHAR support when it's there. Thanks to Artem Gr <artem@bizlink.ru>
00095 // for this...
00096 #ifndef SQLITE3X_USE_WCHAR
00097 #  ifdef _GLIBCXX_USE_WCHAR_T
00098 #    define SQLITE3X_USE_WCHAR 1
00099 #  elif defined(UNICODE) // Windows uses this
00100 #    define SQLITE3X_USE_WCHAR 1
00101 #  else
00102 #    define SQLITE3X_USE_WCHAR 0 // default
00103 #  endif
00104 #endif
00105

00813 //      struct sqlite3_function_info_base
00814 //      {
00815 //      public:
00816 //              enum {
00817 //              TextUTF8 = SQLITE_UTF8,
00818 //              TextUTF16 = SQLITE_UTF16,
00819 //              TextUTF16BE = SQLITE_UTF16BE,
00820 //              TextUTF16LE = SQLITE_UTF16LE,
00821 //              TextAny = SQLITE_ANY
00822 //              };
00823 //              int argc;
00824 //              int text_rep; /* 1: UTF-16.  0: UTF-8 */

00826 //              void (*func)(sqlite3_context*,int,sqlite3_value**);
00827 //              void (*step)(sqlite3_context*,int,sqlite3_value**);

00829 //      protected:
00830 //              sqlite3_function_info_base()

00834 //                        func(0), step(0), final(0)
00835 //              {}
